story:
***Update: The devastating earthquake in Nepal has raised the urgency of ICU Care Boxes and critical care assistance to the Nepalese people to a new level. 

The Tribhuvan University Teaching Hospital (TUTH) is facing a second wave of critically ill patients after the second earthquake on May 12th. 

As a result, we have decided to extend the ICU Care Box Campaign.

We are still accepting donations - please click "Select a Perk" > Continue > Add the Contribution

**N.B. Donations to the ICU Care Boxes are being used directly to treat patients and are not being penalized/redirected by the civil authorities. 

We have been in touch with the Nepal Critical Care Development Foundation (NCCDF) who are using your donations to purchase more ICU Care Boxes for hospital patients and for patients in the outlying regions.  

We are in urgent need of donations to help replenish the ICU Care Boxes supplies. 

Ordinarily, $US8,000 pays to fund one ICU Care box per bed for one year but the overwhelming patient volumes means that this patient time cycle has been shortened dramatically.

A podcast given by Dr. Laura Hawryluck for the Society of Critical Care Medicine (SCCM) on the impact that the ICU Care Boxes are having is available on the SCCM website.

http://www.sccm.org/News/Pages/The-Tragedy-in-Nepal.aspx

***

The Need:

The majority of the Nepali people are poor and cannot pay for health care as there is no health insurance system.Every year patients needlessly lose their lives in an ICU in Nepal just because they cannot afford to buy essential drugs and medical equipment required for their treatment. To compound matters, in an emergency situation, health care workers will order the required equipment and medications,but then the patient’s family must leave the ICU to retrieve, pay for, and return with the supplies to ICU which costs precious minutes in a life and death situation.

The Solution:

Nepal Critical Care Development Foundation (NCCDF):a non-profit non-governmental organization dedicated to improving Critical Care Medicine in Nepal. Dr.Subhash Acharya is the President of the foundation.

Tribhuvan University Teaching Hospital (TUTH): one of the oldest and largest public hospitals in Nepal. TUTH provides high quality, relatively affordable tertiary level health services to people of lower socioeconomic status from across Nepal.

To improve timely and equitable access to lifesaving treatments, NCCDF is pioneering the NCCDF ICU Care Box. This box is a collection of essential medical equipment and supplies located within the ICU for rapid access in an emergency situation. Patients will be asked to replenish the supplies after the emergency has passed. For those unable to afford replenishment, the supplies will be a donation for their care.

The NCCDF Care Boxes are initially being trialled at TUTH. The ultimate goal is to expand the scope to all public hospital ICUs in Nepal.

* Please note that we are unable to provide a Canadian charity tax receipt for funds donated towards this project.

** All contributions towards this initiative are in US dollars. 


The Numbers:

For an 11 bed ICU, we estimate a single Care Box will cost $2000 USD and last 3 months. Annual cost is thus $8000 USD. The foundation will check the inventory at regular intervals, monitoring depletion rate and replacing supplies as required.

If NCCDF is unable to collect the required funds for an ICU Care Box, the money that has been collected will be donated to the NCCDF Poor Patients Fund. The Poor Patient Fund is used to help patients afford their medications during their stay in the ICU.


Summary

NCCDF staff continually witness needless suffering and death within Nepali ICUs due to delays or financial barriers in accessing supplies. The NCCDF Care Box is a simple, inexpensive solution to help improve patient care. Every donation counts no matter how small because even the purchase of a single syringe can make all the difference when saving someone’s life.


THE IMPACT

Any contribution made toward saving lives are always valuable either be it monetary or non-monetary. This project is valuable in the sense that this box will help save a number of lives. We have witnessed how people have suffered needlessly and unnecessarily just because they cannot afford to buy medications in an emergency situation.

This is the first of the care box being implemented at Tribhuvan University Teaching Hospital (TUTH). We are confident of the success and hope to expand the project to other public hospital ICUs in Nepal.

We look forward to your support.

The list of medical supplies and equipment in the Care Box:

1.

Thank you.

story:
I have set this page up with the hope of raising some money to help out Holly and Doug with the costs of having baby Levi in the NICU for the next 12 weeks. Not only will they have to pay to park and for petrol to get to the hospital, but Holly will not be working. 

I cannot even begin to imagine what Holly and Doug are going through or how they are feeling. I would just like to help ease some of the stress and worry this whole situation is no doubt putting on them. 

All donations, no matter how big or small, will make a difference and will be very gratefully accepted. Just $5 will pay their parking for a day. 

Thank you

story:
Our Story

This is my son, Tucker. He's amazing. Seriously. Check out his artwork. He's also heavy -- almost 90 pounds now. That might not sound like much for a young man, but lifting him multiple times on a daily basis is difficult. It's also dangerous, both for Tucker and for his caregivers. Even minor back injuries are debilitating. Plus, a caregiver back injury could result in Tucker being dropped, which could lead to significant injury for him as well.


I have appealed to both private insurance and Medicaid for coverage of a lift system that will enable any caregiver, regardless of their strength, to safely transfer Tucker bed to/from wheelchair and wheelchair to/from bath. Both have denied this request saying it's not a covered benefit.


So, I searched online and applied to several grant-making organizations for financial assistance. To my delight, the First Hand Foundation came through with a grant for $4,000. The most basic, reasonable system quoted to us costs $6,621 and includes installation.


Now, we just have to raise the remaining $2,621. That's where you come in.


Your donation will help us ensure that Tucker can continue to live in his own home with his family and can continue to make his incredible artwork.


If we are fortunate enough to raise more than what is needed for this project, any remaining funds will be donated to charity.

Our Story
This is my son, Tucker. He's amazing. Seriously. Check out his artwork. He's also heavy -- almost 90 pounds now. That might not sound like much for a young man, but lifting him multiple times on a daily basis is difficult. It's also dangerous, both for Tucker and for his caregivers. Even minor back injuries are debilitating. Plus, a caregiver back injury could result in Tucker being dropped, which could lead to significant injury for him as well.

I have appealed to both private insurance and Medicaid for coverage of a lift system that will enable any caregiver, regardless of their strength, to safely transfer Tucker bed to/from wheelchair and wheelchair to/from bath. Both have denied this request saying it's not a covered benefit.

So, I searched online and applied to several grant-making organizations for financial assistance. To my delight, the First Hand Foundation came through with a grant for $4,000. The most basic, reasonable system quoted to us costs $6,621 and includes installation.

Now, we just have to raise the remaining $2,621. That's where you come in.

Your donation will help us ensure that Tucker can continue to live in his own home with his family and can continue to make his incredible artwork.

If we are fortunate enough to raise more than what is needed for this project, any remaining funds will be donated to charity.

story:
Why?

After both of us living and working in Vancouver we discovered Yoga so we decided to try it. From then on we had a new found love… Yoga. Then after travelling back home to Ireland we thought that Ireland was missing something. A pure yoga brand not just other sports wear companies trying to imitate other brands out there. What if we could bring an Irish intepretation on what we had seen on our travels? From there Arwen began..

 

Arwen

First came all our thoughts on were we should start and what should we call our new baby. Why not a Celtic name? We found Arwen completely by mistake one day after seeing many Celtic designs. The three ring symbol also known as the symbol of three rings was a symbol of the balance between male and female energy. From ancient Celtic symbols the first and last rings signified the powers of the 'male' and 'female' respectively. The middle ring signified the balance and equality of the other rings. The importance of the three interlinking Arwen rings can be interpreted that when combined the symbol implies balance, between two opposing powers in the universe. The Arwen name and symbol was just perfect for what we had been working on.

 

Giving back

When forming Arwen we always wondered how we could give back to customers and the community as originally the idea behind starting yoga classes was to meet new people and also to develop the mind and body. What if we could also let our customers decide were we could offer to give back part of our sales to worth while causes? So we decided if we could set aside 10% of all sales to give to worth while causes. We can let our customers decide and offer ideas of were we can help. We'll keep everyone posted as we get more ideas and emails from people. Please feel free to contact us with your ideas!

Why we need your help now

The next step for Arwen is to build our complete web site were we can sell world wide not just at a studio level. We want the world to know about Arwen and expand our product line and manufacture more amazing yoga products! Our first product is a non-slip head band no matter how hard you work it wont come unstuck.
We also have wrist bands in our Arwen blue with embossed logos. All products are manufactured to highest standards to EN and EU regulations.

  

  

As we have spent all our savings on design, development and manufacturing of our first products. We now need your help to carry on with our dream and Arwen.

Each new product cost about $5000 to create, design and manufacture so if we hit our target of $10000 we can get to work on two new products and anything above that would be amazing and we could further expand our product range.

We have created everything from bags to bottles and cant wait to unleash them!

Your help would be amazing and help us move on to the next stage with Arwen.

Many thanks for taking the time to read through our campaign!

story:
***Every bit helps! Even if we don't reach our goal, every dollar will help launch our mission. Consider giving. Either way, we want to see you on June 28th ;) Bring your mat & bring your friends!


www.SculptSquad.com

Sculpt Squad is a community of VIBRANT HEARTS dedicated to practicing & inspiring personal development. Our passion is to facilitate growth thru empowerment and then watch in AWE & Wonder as lives are changed. We create meaningful experiences using a thoughtful blend of power yoga & motivational speaking to encourage health & healing and foster a community devoted to supporting sustainable growth.

We're dedicated to elevating the world around us and we need your help to make it happen.

We're just getting started .. and we can't do it without YOU. We're using this Indiegogo Campaign to launch our movement & raise funds to mobilize our mission. The funds we're raising now will help catalyze our efforts to reach out into local communities & spread our message of HOPE. By supporting us, you are supporting local business and allowing us to begin impacting lives in a powerful way. What you invest into people & lives changed is a guaranteed return in ways you cannot imagine. Be a HERO. People are worth it.

Our goal is to spread the message & experience of Sculpt Squad into businesses, schools, churches and other local communities.

IT ALL STARTS WITH YOU




We're bringing our vision to Life by throwing an EPIC summer celebration & we hope you'll join us!

WHERE?

St. Paul Union Depot
214 E 4th St
St. Paul, MN 55105

WHEN?

Saturday June 28th
7p-10p

MAIN EVENT:

DJ Dance Party + Sculpt Yoga
+ Keynote + a few Surprises

More Details:

DOORS OPEN @ 6p. Bring your own mat & come dressed for some sweaty yoga ;) If you're purchasing a ticket for someone other than yourself, please be sure to leave their name in the comment box when making your pledge. If you want to purchase MULTIPLE TICKETS, indiegogo makes it easy to pledge as many times as you'd like.




First-Edition Sculpt Squad TANK-top

For the gents:

For the ladies:

Be sure to specify which tank you want & what size (S,M,L,XL,XXL)

If you're out of town or just can't come to our launch, shipping is on us! If you're coming to OPERATION: VibrantHearts, we'll hook it up at registration :)




COMING to our Launch? Bring your friends! Can't make it? You can still help our cause. No matter how much you give, it'll go a long way in elevating our communities. To everyone who's passionate about helping us help others: we'd Love it if you could make some noise about what we're up to by using the INDIEGOGO tools to share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or whatever social media you use.

From the bottom of our Hearts: THANK YOU

"We make a living by what we get, but we make a LIFE by what we give."
-Winston Churchill

For the gents:For the ladies:Be sure to specify which tank you want & what size (S,M,L,XL,XXL)If you're out of town or just can't come to our launch, shipping is on us! If you're coming to OPERATION: VibrantHearts, we'll hook it up at registration :)COMING to our Launch? Bring your friends! Can't make it? You can still help our cause. No matter how much you give, it'll go a long way in elevating our communities. To everyone who's passionate about helping us help others: we'd Love it if you could make some noise about what we're up to by using the INDIEGOGO tools to share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or whatever social media you use.From the bottom of our Hearts: THANK YOU"We make a living by what we get, but we make a LIFE by what we give."-Winston Churchill

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things you need to know:

  • My name is Mordeechai Z. Hecht I am 7th Generation New Yorker - Jew
  • 4 Years ago I came across this wonderful book on a online depository of books that are out of print. I used this book as a text book for a weekly class on this Subject of Medicine and the Soul. I taught it for 2 years until we finished the book.
  • If you contribute towards my efforts you will help bring an awesome text back into print and open it's wisdom to the entire world as it will be translated into English with comments, notes and anecdotes, It will be a fabulous book for character development that will promote personal health and yes, global harmony.

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for folks in even more detail:

  • As I am a full time practicing Rabbi, with 20 years of Religious studies and multiple degrees in Jewish and religous thought, (medicine and psychology) I need your help to help me pay bills to cover the costs of this book, as I work with professional editors and fellow Dr's to make this an excellent publication which will benefit all - the professional, the religious person, doctor or laymen, alike. 
  • My perk in return to you, will be: you will get a signed copy of the book as well as printed copy - nicely bound of the original work in it's Hebrew Format: "Refuas Hanefesh - Healing of the Soul by Benjamin Meir of Kremenchug." In addition if you help me your name will be published in the book as a sponsor.
  • If I reach my entire goal this book will go to print within 13 months and will be promoted by the Publisher.

The Impact

  • This project is extremely valuable to the contributor and to the world in that it's wisdom is timeless and priceless.
  • As I am a 7th Generation New Yorker - Jew and a 3rd generation Rabbi - the book will create a buzz in the world - when completed. My large family and well known family name will help in it's promotion and distribution.
  • My experience in making things happen in all my work in education at Chabad Queens is proof that I will bring this book to print - as I am already half way through.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

  • Please share this with your friends and feel free to email me at rabbimzhecht@gmail.com to learn more.
  • And please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Creating Sustainable Health Care in Haiti by Training Local Haitian Doctors 

So many of the staff at the Lion's Gate Emergency Department in North Vancouver have fallen in love with Haiti. Each trip to this country captures us in ways we can often not even express; and so the 'Evans and Francesca' Haiti Child and Maternal Health Fundraising campaign was born. We have since partnered with www.haitivillagehealth.com to help maximize our efforts.

This holiday season we would like to raise $6000 for our young Haitian doctor Billy Ysac to receive more training. Billy has been volunteering at Haiti Village Health's Sante Pou You clinic; and we would like to offer him a salary while he learns how to provide care for the Women and Children of the region during their outreach trips. 

We need your help to bring much needed Child and Maternal Health Care to Haiti and to empower Dr. Billy Ysac and his Haitian community to care for their own through the creation of sustainable health care.

story:
Long County BMX is a Bicycle Motocross track in Ludowici, Georgia. We opened in November of 2010. BMX is a great sport to get kids and their families involved in as it is an individual sport that anyone can participate in. BMX tracks give the youth of the community a place to go that is safe, provides exercise, promotes family togetherness and promotes good sportsmanship.

A BMX track in this commnity offers a choice to keep the youth in the area out of trouble. It is an alternative to the normal football, soccer, baseball and basketball that are offered in the area. Other than the normal sports and this track there is little else for kids to do to stay away from trouble.

Being in a rural community with a high unemployment rate it is difficult for famillies to get involved. We have several ideas as to assist families in getting involved. We are trying to raise at least $3500 to make some minor improvements to the track and track area as well as purchase bicycles and helmets to loan to people that come out who do not have these items and can not purchase them.

Improvements will consist of purchasing new soiltac that was melted from the track during the wildfire that we had in March of 2011 so that we may hold events after it rains and not have to wait days and days for the track to dry out, items for registration such as new computer and printer to make races run smoothly. We will also be purchasing several complete bikes and full face helmets for people who will be coming out to try BMX so that they will not have to purchase anything to try it out.


 

Please let anyone who may interested in this project about it.

story:
My mom's story

Debbie Joyce, my mother and a friend to many over the years Is battling a very aggressive lung cancer. Many people have asked how they can help, and now is the time! My mom has accumulated an extraordinary amount of hospital bills, as well as prescriptions, Ect. 


I am setting a goal of $1000 for myself. My moms prescriptions alone last month were over $1000. I hope to have this to give to her by April 1st, the date of the winners event in Norfolk va. Although my goal is high, every little bit helps. 

This is mainly for those who can't attend the event on the 1st, and my friends in philly and across the country. Do not feel obligated to donate if you will be attending the event on the 1st! 

Thank you to everyone who has supported my family in this tough time. Together we can all kick some cancers ass!!!

story:
Talk Therapy TV and "Pledge A Lace"

Talk Therapy TV is a 501(c)3 not-for-profit that serves the many people suffering from mental illness such as depression, PTSD, bi-polar, schizophrena as well as those who have been exposed to bullying.

The One Million Laces campaign will help get the conversation going about mental illess and eleviate the stigma associated with seeking treatment through the use of "QUICK FACT" (QF) shoelaces.

QUICK FACT Shoelaces each have a mental health fact printed on the lace. You can wear the lace as a stmbol of your pledge to advocate and support those who suffer with a mental illness. This would be your pledge to help get the conversation going as well that eliminates the stigma that prevents people from seeking treatment.

There are many different facts on the laces which provides you with the opportunity to share those facts with others. You have the opportunity to exchange laces with others to further educate others with more facts.

We need your contribution of $4.95 to the One Million Lace campaign. Your help and participation gets you a "Quick Fact" (QF) shoelace as a tool to show your support and to help educate others.

The proceeds of the One Million Laces campaign will fund mental health outreach services, mental health television programming, on-line awareness and educational projects and treatment referrals.

We Need You To Pledge To Get The Conversation Going!

When you begin helping the campaign to get the conversation going and to fund mental health awareness, education and outreach you make a pledge to;

  1. share the QF laces with people who have not seen them and have not heard the facts.
  2. exchange laces and get new facts to share with those you know.
  3. openly speak about how natural an occurance mental illness can be.

You will receive

  1. a (QF) shoelace as your tool to help get the conversation going.
  2. a download key to receive a newly release song and message of hope from Grammy Nominee Martha Wash.
  3. a chance to further your awareness of mental health facts.
  4. a chance to further others awarenes of mental health issues. 

Let's Get The Conversation Going!

story:
Why neat-os?

Several years ago, I swore I’d never buy another plastic baggie.  

Sure enough, I found myself wanting one! I was sick of washing out plastic bags and felt guilty every time I threw one away. But I needed something small and malleable to fit in a tight spot in a lunch box. Figuring someone had already invented such a bag, I combed the Internet. I found lots of reusable bags but none of them was what I was looking for.

So I set out to create my own reusable bag that had all the features I was looking for: 

  • created with food storage in mind
  • could be used hundreds of times
  • allowed you to see the contents inside without opening it
  • made with food safe materials (BPA-, PHTHALATE-, AND PVC-FREE)
  • easy to wash, dishwasher or washing machine safe
  • no velcro closure (food gets stuck in velcro)

neat-os design

Before my children were born, I worked in the restaurant business. Once a mom, I wanted work with more flexible hours so I took my hobby of interior design and grew it into a residential design firm that offered clients sustainable design. I learned all about environmentally friendly products and practices along the way. I also developed an appreciation for minimalism.  

So when I decided to create neat-os I put these two experiences together: I wanted a clean, minimalist, eco-conscious design that I could also imagine being used by the chefs I had worked with. The clean design allowed the option to personalize the bags so anyone could put fun drawings, patterns or labels on them. 

I researched and experimented, made a prototype, got feedback from my community, especially my kids, found a manufacturer, tested and experimented some more, decided on sizes and colors to offer, and opened for e-business. In the process, I discovered that the bags I'd created keep your fresh food fresh longer, which is why we are now launching a new size: the Produce Bag (see perks).

neat-os products

Two of our main goals at neat-os are global sustainability and making it easy for busy people to be more eco-conscious and do away with single use disposable items. By pledging on Indiegogo, you are joining the reusable movement or stepping up your commitment if you're already a passionate member of this movement.  

neat-os come in a variety of sizes to accommodate your needs. In addition to functional, efficient food storage, neat-os have a myriad of other uses, see lots of them here.

  • Snack bag, 7' x 4": we use these for: apple slices- crackers- pencil case- nuts- half a bagel- lip balm- check book- breath mints- gym card w/energy bar- first-aid kit
  • Sandwich bag, 7" x 6.5": we use these for: hearty sandwich- markers- art supplies- herbs- cut up veggies- TSA friendly toiletries- homemade cookies- make-up 

  • Gallon bag, 10.5" x 11.0": we use these for: food storage- lettuce- freezer cooking prep- beach day- baked goods- swim suit & goggles- bulk food- travel bag for chargers- emergency supplies- seasonal decorations

  • Produce bag, 10.5" x 11.0": INTRODUCED HERE ON INDIEGOGO! This is the bag for all of your GREENS! When we found out how fresh the bags keep produce, we knew we needed an extra tall one for kale, celery, romaine, any of those tall veggies. It's also great for more general storage!

Why neat-os needs your help

Sounds good so far, right? Well I kept selling out! The manufacturer I found at first couldn't make enough bags for the demand and produced bags of inconsistent quality. I put production on hold until I could find someone who could grow with me and make a top quality product consistently. Although it cost most to have the bags made in the US, it is something I am committed to. It took a year and a half, but I finally found someone -- and in my backyard! I now have a new manufacturer in Los Angeles, 20 minutes from my home.  Supporting local economies is another tenet of the neat-os mission so I'm especially thrilled.

However, the minimum orders with this new manufacturer are much higher and we need more machines to make the bags. I am hoping to raise $30,000 to cover these costs.  The money will allow me to purchase:

  • $4,000 in fabrics 
  • $2,000 in zippers 
  • $15,000 for local assembly and production
  • $9,000 for machines (sewing, serger, and pad printing machines)

neat-os Commitment 

neat-os is firmly committed to global sustainability and supporting local economies.  We believe in: 

  • Top quality, design and functionality in product development
  • Thoughtful consumption, minimal environmental impact, and supporting groups that work to clean up the environment, proud member of 1% for the Planet!
  • Job creation in the US and supporting local economies
  • Building a community around a shared outlook for a better future

Mostly, I am thrilled that neat-os makes it easier for people to be more environmentally friendly. I love hearing the many ways people are using them, so once you get your neat-os be sure to share with us on our blog or on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest or Instagram! 

Also, we would greatly appreciate if you help spread the word and share our video and Indiegogo page with friends. If you have any questions or just want to introduce yourself, please email me anytime at: rachel@neat-os.com

Thanks so much for your support!

story:
I Don't Know About You...

But I’m feelin' twenty-two. And let me be honest, I never thought I would live this long. No, I don’t have a terminal illness or anything as dire as that. Let me backtrack here - my name is Penn and I’m one of strangest little guys you’ll ever meet, but somehow my body didn’t get that message. Are you following where I’m going with this? You better sit down. When I was born my parents named me Penelope. No, it isn’t a very good name for a boy, you’re right. And therein lies the problem. My body and my brain aren’t on the same page, my “genes” are, but some wires got crisscrossed when Dr. Frankenstein was putting me together.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We're talking six thousand, just to start with. These procedures are hella expensive.
  • You want that charity merch? We got that charity merch. You want art? I invented art. Let's talk. 
  • Indiegogo wants me to tell you what I'm going to do with the money if I don't meet my goal. But I'm totally going to meet my goal. Your move, Internet. 

What It Means To Me

I never thought I’d live to see the inside of a therapist’s office, let alone be the one sitting on the couch. So never say never, friends. As comfortable as that couch is though, the caveat is its price tag. It leaves a burning hole in your back pocket. $40 for 50 minutes with my wonderful head shrink, Glenda Davenport, and that’s with insurance. The well’s running dry and I know there’s no rain coming. I think you know what happens then, sad as it is to admit. It’s getting expensive as hell to be crazy and I haven’t even gotten to the snip, snip, clip, clip, paying to get shots on my butt - yikes! I really do need your help this time.

"I don't have money, bro..."

Bless whatever deity you believe in if you even took the time to glance over all this mumbo jumbo here before you. Any and every contribution you leave here will not go unappreciated. Even if you think about tossing me a dime, bless your soul, my friend. You really are giving me a chance here and I will always be forever grateful for that. Thank you. If I can ever do anything to repay you for your kindness, I really do want you to let me know.

Three, two, one... Time's up! Credit cards down!

If you didn't get the chance to throw your spare change at me - but for some reason still really want to - through the wonders of the internet, you still can. That's all super pro bono after-hours good deeding though: 


https://www.paypal.com/webapps/mpp/send-money-online

Email address: pactonn@gmail.com

story:
If we need 10.000$, it will mostly be to buy the proper equipment, as this project requires technologie. To be able to help a village for 2 doctors living in the United States, you can imagine that a proper screen, computer, and medical tools are strongly needed. 
We some of this money, we will be able to support on site the volunteer nurses (2) that will come and manage this project on site.

As we believe that contributors will appears and follow us in this adventure, Life Steppers give you the opportunity to come and visit the village. 
The more you support us, the better welcome we will give you.

  • This telemedicine project is the meeting between two NGO, leaded by people that decided to change their life by caring and sharing.

SAMASTA HEALTH FOUNDATION 


& 

LIFE STEPPERS

Samasta Health Foundation improve access to healthcare and essential medicines
Life steppers jump into a new lifestyle, sharing and helping helpless people.

  • what is TELEMEDICINE ?

Telemedicine offers a moldable solution to the specifics needs of each community. It also collapses the distance between the healthcare teams and the patient so that a care plan can take effect no matter where they are. 

The patient can either call us or come to our clinic in hours of operations Monday to Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00PM. 

Our team is on stand by 24/7 so that if the patients need to see a doctor after hours this can be made possible.

The doctor and the patient will connect through the internet and video conference and by using new tools the doctor will examine  the patient.

If it's necessary, the doctor will then write a prescription which will be printed by our staff.

The patients can then get the medication they need on site. 


In the world, it is estimated that there are between 1.3 to 2.1 billion people without access to essential medicines. 

Cough, congestion, common cold, eye itchiness, minor eye infections, urinary infections, overactive bladder, skin rashes, eczema, vomiting, diarrhea, nausea, headache, sinus infection, ear infection. 

Many of these diseases have simple solutions but without prompt care they can lead to unecessary  complications. 

Thanks to the telemedicine project, the patients have access to a doctor located abroad, able to do a through examination (auscultate), diagnose and treat thanks to technology. Can you imagine how this can help? can you believe that from far away doctors are able to diagnostic sick patients ?
With the Samasta health Foundation tele clinic project it is today possible.
We only need a small help to settle it and get the equipments needed.
This is the second tele clinic in the world, after the one in Columbia.
Be part of it, come and visit us, and let us welcome you in the better way thanks to your contribution. 
Please have a look at our websites for more informations.
https://www.facebook.com/lifestepperszanzibar
https://www.samastahealthfoundation.org
http://www.lifesteppers.org

And thanks a lot to read us, follow us, and believe in what we do.

story:
In May of 2015, I was in Lagos, Nigeria celebrating my birthday.

My story became full circle when yet again friends and family members repeatedly ask me, "how did you grow you hair back?" I knew it was time to not only share my story with them; it was time to share Dr. Herbal, Organic Hair Oil (Dr. Herbal) with others: FDA approved hair oil. 

Meet the Owner

My name is Sharon Osinaike, and I created Dr. Herbal, Organic Hair Oil. An all natural herbal organic hair oil that provides nourishment to your hair and prevents hair loss naturally.

Let’s be honest, hair loss is not really talked about because unfortunately it can be embarrassing; instead of finding ways to improve it, we find ways to cover it up. I am speaking honestly, to share my story and my product to help others regain their hair. Our hair is a part of who we are, it tells a story. Hair has the power to dictate how others will treat us, and in turn, how we feel about ourselves. Losing hair can be devastating, as I learned. I started losing my hair due to tension to my hair follicles from certain hairstyles, mostly from wearing braids. I also notice after having my firstborn my hair loss became worst. I know I am not the only woman who has experienced losing hair during or after a pregnancy, it can be tragic. 

After being told by a doctor, that my hair loss was from a hormonal imbalance due to breastfeeding my eldest son and hairstyles; I decided to take matters into my own hands by figuring out a product and a regimen that worked best for me.

Since using my organic hair oil, I have overcome my hair loss, and my hair grew back stronger. I applied the oil to balding spots daily and my hairline improved significantly within a few months. Regardless, if I used it 3 days a week or 7 days a week. I quickly realized IT WORKED!  I immediately saw results. By the time my second child was born, I was really impressed with my results. Then, when my last born came along, I was no longer experienced hair loss. Now, from my research, here I am years later in business telling men and women who are experiencing hair loss that it is possible to re-grow their hair. 

Putting Your Contributions To Work 

There is no direct cost of sales for services, since the service costs are direct cost. The donations received will be used to get the hair oil bottled, labeled and shipped to Lagos Nigeria. I am seeking $5,000.00 in total for the below items. 

  • Labels,
  • Bottles and caps,
  • Pumping machine to pump the oil into the bottles,
  • Shipment fees. 
  • Cost to manufacture product  

​Below image shows cost (see enlarged image above in gallery). 

Check out the fantastic perks as a part of this campaign for your donation. Your contributions can score you a perk if you choose too, or just click on the button above and donate. Any donation will make a difference and means so much to me.  

Lastly, benefits of the hair oil...

Dr.  Herbal, is exceptionally unique. It contains pure essential oils and herbal extracts. Used to nourish your roots, fight dandruff and leave it soft, shiny and full of life. If used regularly Dr. Herbal can promote new hair growth. This product is for anyone without regard to sex, race, or color if you are experiencing hair loss.

  • Eliminates hair loss
  • Repairs damaged hair and bald patches
  • Rapid hair growth, and hair strengthener
  • Anti-dandruff
  • No side effects, with an ancient remedy

How to apply: Apply daily, directly to problem areas and massage, 3 to 5 days a week or as often as you like. If used only for maintenance you may apply the oil directly on hair strands. Style normally or prepare for sleep for the night. The stimulation process takes its course through regular massages that promote and increase hair growth. It improves blood circulation, and rejuvenates your scalp and hair follicles. Regular use of hair oil keeps your hair thick, shiny, lustrous, fuller, beautiful and healthy. Hair growth may be seen in 2-6 weeks or sooner. 

This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to help and encourage others who are experiencing hair loss. I believe everyone who wants quality hair care deserves it, especially those distressed by hair loss. With your help, I can make this possible. There is a growing demand for products that actual work and Dr, Herbal is that product. I aim to STOP hair loss or minimize its effects and restore customers hair to their former glory. 

I’m thankful for this journey. It allowed me to understand that my identity was not tied to my hair and I found the strength to not care what others thought. I found a greater self-awareness and a deeper spiritual awakening. Had I not learned this, my journey would never have brought me to this moment in time of you reading my story. 

Please share on Facebook or other social media outlets, use the Indiegogo share buttons, and tell your friends!

Thank you, 

Sharon Osinaike - Dr. Herbal, Organic Hair Oil

VISIT OUR WEBSITE: http://www.drhairoil.com

story:
"Of all disease-transmitting insects, the mosquito is the greatest menace, spreading malaria, dengue and yellow fever, which together are responsible for several million deaths and hundreds of millions of cases every year.  Mosquitoes also transmit lymphatic filariasis and Japanese encephalitis." - World Health Organization

1REPEL, a mosquito repellent LED light, has been developed over many years, and now is ready to help stop these dreaded diseases.  We invite you to join us on our journey to prevent mosquito-borne deaths and illness and spread the word about this revolutionary product.

The WHO continues, "Malaria is endemic in 91 countries, with about 40% of the world's population at risk.  By undermining the health and working capacity of hundreds of millions, it is closely linked to poverty and stunts social and economic development. Up to 500 million cases occur every year, 90% of them in Africa, and there are up to 2.7 million deaths annually."

Zika, a new-to-the world disease, is threatening the Western Hemisphere, especially South America.  As this disease gains traction,  1REPEL aims to stop it from becoming the plague that Malaria presents in the East.  Zika is already advancing in the U.S.  With approximately 30,000 pregnant women in Florida alone, we worry for the fate of these babies and strive to be able to provide them the protection that 1REPEL gives.  We require your help to be able to accomplish this goal.

Our founder, began working on this problem in his youth and continues to research and experiment ways to stop mosquitoes from biting humans and animals, thus spreading diseases.  The 1REPEL light has proven to be the most successful product to date and we are offering you the opportunity to protect your home and loved ones as well as encouraging others to join us too.

1REPEL uses light technology that repels mosquitoes most effectively in the 5-15 foot range.  To obtain optimal coverage, multiple units work best. Currently, 1REPEL is only available in the United States.

Any amount is appreciated with our humble gratitude.  We offer you the opportunity to try 1REPEL for yourself, before it is available to the public, by supporting our quest.

Ultimately, this is a mission to stop the spread of these entirely preventable diseases and rid the world of their extreme health, social and economic impacts.

With your initial support, we will be able to speed up production and distribution of our lights.  We will also support other organizations in the battle against mosquito-carrying diseases like Malaria and Zika.  Beyond that, we will continue to provide technology that protects against mosquitoes in an even safer, cleaner, and easier-to-use manner.  We will strive to get our light to the furthest and darkest places around the world, particularly third-world countries that need our technology most.  We want to make sure that all people on this planet can work and enjoy their activities in the outdoors without the fear of mosquitoes and the diseases they carry.

Alone, we can move pebbles, but TOGETHER we can move mountains.

More information available at: 1Repel.com

story:
*Updates* 

  • April 24: Come to the Buffalo Wild Wings fundraiser! Support our cause just by eating at the Buffalo Wild Wings right outside of the Hamilton Mall! If you show or bring a ticket with you, 10% of the cost of your meal will go to our cause.
    4311 E Black Horse Pike, Mays Landing, NJ 08330 Click here to print your ticket!
  • There are now tables throughout Stockton's campus where you can get your Buffalo Wild Wings tickets! Baked goods are also being sold at the tables. All proceeds go to the Serenity House.

Summary

Be the person who grants recovery.

Drug and alcohol addiction steals mothers, brothers, fathers and daughters, teachers, neighbors and friends- it shows no mercy. Rehabilitation centers across the country work with people to cope with their addiction and set them on the road to recovery- but none do so like Serenity House.

Serenity House is a refuge, offering a restorative community for men and women recovering from alcohol and/or drug addiction. Serenity House is a division of The Hansen Foundation, Inc, founded by Jennifer Hansen. 

What We Need & What You Get

Be the person who gives hope. 

According to the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration's 'National Survey on Drug Use and Health' 23.5 million persons aged 12 or older needed treatment for an illicit drug or alcohol abuse problem in 2009.

Serenity House provides these treatments. However, as a non-profit organization, Serenity House is only able to continue providing a safe, constructive environment through generous donations. What we need is people like you who want to make a difference in someone's life, just like the Serenity House does. The funds that we gather will go towards making Blessing Bags that contain essential personal hygiene items, as well as bedding that the residents need first thing when they get to the house.

Everyone who donates to our cause will be receiving a personal thank you from us, and of course your donation will give you a warm, fuzzy feeling inside from knowing that you will be personally responsible for helping to give people their lives back after suffering from the terrible disease of addiction.


The Impact

Be the person who grants serenity. 

Addiction runs deep. It affects not only the individual, but their friends and family, and their communities. Your contribution will make a difference in the lives of many. Since its inception in 2007, nearly 90% of Serenity House alumnae have successfully maintained recovery. Your donation will not only provide essential items for Serenity House residents, but also give hope, and empowerment to people seeking a better life.


"Today, I am a good mother, daughter, sister, employee and friend. I wake up every morning with gratitude and hope, and THAT is the true gift of Serenity House." - Serenity House Alumna

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help. Spread the word out and make some noise about our campaign via social media. Check out the Serenity House on Facebook : SerenityHouseNJ Facebook

FAQ

1. What is the Serenity House and the Hansen Foundation?

- The Hansen Foundation’s purpose is to help recovering addicts. They provide men and women with the necessary life skills to lead a productive and sober life. The Hansen Foundation owns and operates Serenity House, and three extended-care recovery residences in Atlantic County, New Jersey. The Serenity House is a transitional sober-living house for men and women. The residents live in a supportive & restorative, drug & alcohol free environment while learning how to be responsible members of the community.

2. How are we helping Serenity House?

- We have chosen to help the men and women of the Serenity House, which is a step down from a half-way house. It is a sober living environment where recovering addicts can stay for up to eighteen months. It is imperative that those in recovery learn life skills on their own and avoid triggers that may cause a relapse during the process.  We are trying our best to raise any kind of money to help these men and women. We have different levels of goals we plan to reach throughout the process.

3. What are the donations going towards?

- We have chosen to use any kinds of donations to help build blessing bags for these men and women. A blessing bag is something we can personally give these men and women through the help of the foundation. We have contacted the women who created this foundation, Jennifer Hansen, to see what these women really need. Our ultimate goal for the blessing bags is to give around 42 beds brand new comforters. Jennifer told us that the men and women love new bedding because it makes the environment more “homey”. We want these men and women to be as comfortable as they can be during their brave recovery. If we accomplish the goal of 42 brand new comforters, we are going to use the extra donations to buy these men and women other things that they need. If we do reach this goal, we will making another shopping trip to buy personal hygiene items such as tooth brushes, deodorant, tooth paste, shampoo and etc. Some of those in recovery come in with absolutely nothing, so we are looking forward to helping them.

4. Who are we, what is our class?

- We are a full class at Richard Stockton University. We are a class within service learning which gives us the opportunity to get out in the real world, take direct or indirect action in national or community service. Our class is Rhetoric of Social Media, which is teaching us different ways to use Rhetoric through social media platforms.

5. Why are we doing this project?

- As a class, we chose to help The Serenity House, a part of Hansen Foundation. We want to be able to help local people in need with the help of your donations. These men and women are trying to regain control of their lives and The Serenity House can use some help from us in the process. Many people can relate to this situation through addiction within their family, friends, or even a past addiction themselves.

6. What is Richard Stockton University?

- We are New Jersey’s distinctive public college located in South Jersey. We have over eight thousand full and part time students and are ranked top tier of the Best Regional Colleges and Universities of the North (America’s Best Colleges for 2015) by U.S News and World Report.

7. What are our goals during this campaign?

- Our first goal is to raise 500 dollars for the blessing bags for these men and women. We plan to do a shopping trip so we can help out as many of these men and women as possible. We want to make sure we have enough bedding to include everyone in the house. Our second goal is to try to gain sponsorship by a chain restaurant around the area. We are going to try to ask for any donations they might be willing to give the Hansen Foundation. Our ultimate goal, which we hope to achieve, is to get Stockton involved. We are going to try our best, knowing that we may not succeed at this, to get a scholarship for a deserving man or woman in the foundation. We want to see these men and women succeed in their recovery and in life after they leave the house.

Serenity House, which is a step down from a half-way house. It is a sober living
environment where recovering addicts can stay for up to eighteen months. It is imperative that those in recovery learn life skills on their own and avoid triggers that may cause a relapse during the process.  We are trying our best to raise any kind of money to help these men and women. We have different levels of goals we plan to reach throughout the process.
3. What are the donations going towards?
- We have chosen to use any kinds of donations to
help build blessing bags for these men and women. A blessing bag is something
we can personally give these men and women through the help of the foundation. We have
contacted the women who created this foundation, Jennifer Hansen, to see what
these women really need. Our ultimate goal for the blessing bags is to give
around 42 beds brand new comforters. Jennifer told us that the men and women love new bedding because it makes the environment more “homey”. We want
these men and women to be as comfortable as they can be during their brave recovery. If
we accomplish the goal of 42 brand new comforters, we are going to use
the extra donations to buy these men and women other things that they need. If we
do reach this goal, we will making another shopping trip to buy personal
hygiene items such as tooth brushes, deodorant, tooth paste, shampoo and etc.
Some of those in recovery come in with absolutely nothing, so we are looking forward
to helping them.
4. Who are we, what is our class?
- We are a full class at Richard Stockton
University. We are a class within service learning which gives us the
opportunity to get out in the real world, take direct or indirect action in
national or community service. Our class is Rhetoric of Social Media, which is
teaching us different ways to use Rhetoric through social media platforms. 

5. Why are we doing this project?
- As a class, we chose to help The Serenity House, a
part of Hansen Foundation. We want to be able to help local people in need with the help of your donations. These men and women are trying to regain control of their lives and The Serenity House can use some help from us in the process. Many people can relate to this situation through addiction
within their family, friends, or even a past addiction themselves. 
6. What is Richard Stockton University? 
- We are New Jersey’s distinctive public college located in South Jersey. We have over eight thousand full and part time
students and are ranked top tier of the Best Regional Colleges and Universities
of the North (America’s Best Colleges for 2015) by U.S News and World Report. 
7. What are our goals during this campaign? 
- Our first goal is to raise 500 dollars for the
blessing bags for these men and women. We plan to do a shopping trip so we can help out
as many of these men and women as possible. We want to make sure we have enough bedding
to include everyone in the house. Our second goal is to try to gain sponsorship by
a chain restaurant around the area. We are going to try to ask for any donations they might be willing to give the Hansen Foundation. Our
ultimate goal, which we hope to achieve, is to get Stockton involved. We are
going to try our best, knowing that we may not succeed at this, to get a scholarship for a deserving man or woman in the foundation. We want to
see these men and women succeed in their recovery and in life after they leave the
house.

story:
Movember Celebration Party - March 30th 2012

Be Sure to share your Stache on FB at http://www.facebook.com/events/490472224316418

It's Not the Mustache Ride, but it is a reason to show off the perfectly groomed (usually not) Moustache for another great cause. In celebration of the Movember movement to promote men's health (http://us.movember.com/) we have been asked to help get all our Moustaches out for one last big event for 2012. The Movember Party will take place at at McKnights on Nov 30th, 2012. 

$10 Donation at the door and all proceeds will go to the MOvember Movement! Watch in the coming weeks for Pre-Purchase donations and perks for donating more from Steamboat Tonight and McKnights!


Signup today, and we will let you know about Specials throughout the month to show off your moustache! 

Why a Stache? 

The popularity of the moustache in society has been a long journey full of ups and downs. Over the course of history, men with facial hair have been ascribed various attributes such as wisdom, sexual virility, masculinity, or a higher status. Equally, the moustache has fallen on less illustrious times and it's popularity has dwindled as a result of being sported by some notorious dictators of the world. That said, the moustache has proved itself to be resilient and just when it's thought that they've been resigned to the halls of history, a cultural revolution will swing the pendulum back and usher in a new day for moustaches. After all, the moustache is King.

http://us.movember.com/mo-community/moustachery/

The Impact

The truth is, men are often known to be more indifferent towards their health when compared to the efforts of women, who proactively and publicly address their health issues in a way not traditionally seen with men. As a result, today the levels of awareness, understanding and funding for men’s health issues, like prostate cancer, lag significantly behind other causes.

Movember aims to change the face of men’s health and reverse this way of thinking by putting a fun twist on this serious issue. Using the moustache as a catalyst, we want to bring about change and give men the opportunity and confidence to talk about their health more openly.

Movember's primary objective is to raise awareness and funds for men's health issues, specifically prostate and testicular cancer initiatives. We want everyone to know that most cancers are highly curable if caught in the early stages, therefore Movember aims to increase early detection, diagnosis and effective treatment. This will ultimately reduce the number of deaths from cancer.

For More about Movember and this international movement about men's health check out http://us.movember.com/ and to make a bigger impact, signup and help raise more funds from all your friends!

story:
Urgent: we launch the campaign SILVINA MWARUMBA.
Silvina is a 44-year-old woman who was diagnosed with bladder cancer from July 2011.

We are Susanna Gomez Sole y Donatella Tarasco, presidents of CHILDREN OF AFRICA & MAISHA SAFI, two small European NGOs. We operate togheter to improve the socio-economical situacion of rural villages in Kinango District (Coast Province) one of the poorest districts in Kenya.
 
We need your help to save the life of Silvina Mwarumba.This is her story:
 
Silvina is a 44-year-old woman who was diagnosed with bladder cancer from July 2011. Since she was diagnosed with cancer last summer,she, her husband, her children (educated through our sponsorship program) have suffered the unthinkable and surprisingly quiet, resigned to a tragic end. Only after much suffering her husband, Job Mwarumba, asked us for help. Immediately we donated 1000 euro (500 Children of Africa and 500 Maisha Safi) to allow the immediate admission of Silvina in Aga Khan Hospital(Mombasa), which very quickly raised up to 2,000 euros before she could leave the hospital.

Silvina suffers from "squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder", a bladder cancer that is more than 10 cm, but that has not metastasized or damaged other organs.

According to the forecasts of European doctors is a fully operable cancer and would do well even if operated here. However, the diagnose of doctors in Kenya is rather pessimistic "with no hope of salvation" and a minimun cost of 10,000 Euros to admit her in hospital and get operated. This is the reason why we decided to find a better and safer way to operate her.
 
We found a Urologist in Spain (Canary Islands) that will operate her for free in a private clinic with the only cost of the post-operation and radiotherapy. 
The problem is that Silvina will still need the money for the passport, for the two flight tickets  (for her and her husband) to reach Europe from Kenya, and money for the clinic and maintenance in Spain.
 
We have estimated, along with the doctors, that the total amount will be 4,000/5,000 Euros, considerably better than  the total they proposed us in KENYA and with the hope that in this way she could have more oportunity to be saved.

However, both the Children of Africa Maisha Safi, are very small and young organisations, and will not be able to cover all these expenses. Many fundraising events should be organized with massive participation to reach in a short time what Silvina needs, if we don't want to cut funds from other projects already planned and agreed to develop in Tsunza, Dzivani and Lutsangani next summer 2013 to help the many villagers and students.

But we could never sit with folded arms, and we appeal to join hands together, so that, when adding one to another, we reach a great goal. This is our campaign for Silvina Mwarumba, this is our call for help. We all know that if we join every small amount from each of us, we can do so much for her!
 
 
For all the info (including medical documents and scans) visit the blog: http://mwarumba.blogspot.com/ 
Thank you.
Maisha Safi & Children of Africa

story:
Summary: Help the Friends of Warren Ballpark Preserve the Real Field of Dreams

 

Warren Ballpark established in 1909 and located in historic Bisbee, Arizona, is arguably the oldest continuously used ballpark in the nation.  Its 103 years of history has taken its toll. The ballpark is owned by the Bisbee School District which is increasingly strapped for funds. The Friends of Warren Ballpark is a non-profit organization whose mission is to partner with the district to raise funds to maintain this historic treasure.

 

In addition to this Indiegogo campaign, the Friends will host the 4th Copper City Classic Vintage Base Ball tournament fundraiser on April 6 and 7, 2013. This year the tournament celebrates “the Tour to End All Tours” major league baseball’s 1913-14 tour that stopped over in Bisbee. The Bisbee Black Sox, the local vintage base ball team, will play other teams wearing old-style uniforms and playing by1860 rules. Donate and receive tickets to the tournament.

 

From its earliest days as a baseball field, Warren Ballpark has hosted high school teams, semi pro teams, outlaw teams, minor league teams and visiting major league teams. In 1937, the original wooden stands built in 1909 were demolished and the grandstands used today were constructed by the WPA. The first game played here to dedicate the new grandstands April 6, 1937 was between the Chicago Cubs and Chicago White Sox. Many notable coaches and players have stepped onto its field as barnstorming big leaguers or as minor league players hoping to make their way up to the “Big Show.” Notable players and coaches such as Charlie Metro, Frank Lucchesi, Lefty Phillips, Billie Martin, Earl Wilson, Roy Partee, Clarence Maddern, Bert Shepard and Clint Courtney, played or coached at Warren Ballpark to name only a few.

 

There is growing recognition, by Bisbee leaders, the city visitor’s center and historians, of the ballpark’s significance in the history of Bisbee and the history of baseball. Warren Ballpark is listed in Digital Ballparks.com. It is referenced in baseball-research.com a site maintained by the Society of American Baseball Research and featured in many magazines such as American Profiles. This beloved community landmark continues to be used year round by both the school and the public for sporting, cultural, and community events. 

 

If there really are ghosts of baseball players past who return to play out their glory days on a field of dreams, this is the place they return to: the REAL Field of Dreams.

 

What We Need

 

We need your help to address one of the ballpark’s most critical needs, replacement of aging, unsanitary and dilapidated restrooms with free-standing, multiple stall, ADA compliant, water efficient public restrooms designed to harmonize with the historic character of the grandstands. Replacement of the restrooms is critical for the following reasons:

 

  • The current restrooms, located under the grandstand, are 75 years old and in desperate need of replacement. 
  • The men’s restroom presents a health hazard as it lacks a sink and the urinal is currently inoperable.
  • The women’s restroom is also antiquated and deteriorated and can’t be reached using a wheelchair due to steep steps and its location behind the batting cages.
  • Replacing the existing plumbing located under the historic grandstands could compromise the historic character of the grandstands thus replacing these unsanitary restrooms with free-standing restrooms supports conservation of the historic grandstands.
  • The new restrooms will also replace deteriorated single stall football restrooms.
  • The current restrooms are inadequate for crowds that attend various public events.
  • The school district lacks the funds to maintain this historic park.

 

The Impact

Warren Ballpark is still used by high school baseball and football teams, little league, semi-pro baseball and for many community events such as the Vintage Base Ball tournament, the Blues Festival and the Cancer Race for the Cure. It’s also increasingly seen as a valued tourist attraction. The aging, inadequate public restrooms on both the baseball and football side are limiting its value as a community resource. Your donation will help ensure that our beloved park remains a community and national treasure for another 103-years.

How You Can Help

With this campaign the Friends are trying to raise $6000 to be used to meet matching funds requirements for grant applications. $6000 is a modest goal towards meeting the overall $95,000 cost of replacing the aging restrooms at Warren Ballpark.

  • The Friends would be honored to receive any level of tax-deductible donation that you are comfortable giving.  
  • Second, and of equal importance, we would greatly appreciate it if you would share this email with your friends. You may be in contact with folks who are unaware of our venerable ballpark but share our interest in baseball history and preserving a ballpark of historic significance.

 

Step up to the plate and hit a home run for historic Warren Ballpark in Bisbee, Arizona.

See us at www.friendsofwarrenballpark.com/ and on Facebook.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Potential Energy

My name is Richard Gartner, a yoga teacher in Pittsburgh, PA since 2005. My mission as a teacher is simple: teach yoga in a way that focuses on self-awareness and individual abilities. 

I want everybody in the world to have the tools to discover themselves, to celebrate their strengths, and to honor their limits. My contribution to this mission includes developing yoga practices for an array of abilities, intentions, and situations.

Your support can help me with this mission.

The Art of Self-Practice

I'm developing an app called Onward Facing Yoga for those who practice yoga and those who teach it. It will be available as a free download with five sequences and full functionality. The complete version gives you access to an additional six sequences.

For those who practice: Choose a sequence that best meets your needs and abilities and press play. You'll be guided with accurate, easy-to-follow instructions, and gorgeous illustrations by fellow Pittsburgh resident David Pohl. Check out the gallery for examples of the illustrations and the design.

You can also choose how long practice is and lengthen or shorten any sequence to fit your schedule.

A Resource for Yoga Teachers

Yoga instructors can use the app as a guide sheet for teaching classes. Every guide sheet contains:

  • the theme of each sequence 
  • English and Sanskrit names of all poses
  • an illustration of the pose
  • two or three key cues to focus on 

You can use this app as material for a class you've just been asked to sub for in 15 minutes or as a springboard for developing your own ideas.

So Why Become a Backer? 

Pittsburgh’s yoga community has been really good to me, and the support of my students and clients allowed me to develop version 1.0 of the app. So when you contribute to the campaign, you'll receive all the perks at your donation level. I guarantee it, pinky-swear.

Choose a perk, and the full funding of this campaign will help me spread the word and roll out additional sequences based on user feedback.

It’s also my intention to add functionality and expand accessibility. If this campaign goes beyond its goal, I have many more ideas. I wish to develop it as an Android product. I also dream about adding the ability to design your own sequences, develop it for other languages, and such things.

Kudos to You!

I've designed Onward Facing Yoga in a way that takes the pressure out of conforming to a pose and directs the student toward energetic movement and felt sense. The practices guide the student in a way that makes sense to them, not to look a certain way. It's what's on the inside that counts.

Please check out the perks and consider supporting my efforts to develop a yoga that promotes self-confidence, self-awareness, and individual expression. Also consider sharing this with any like-minded individuals who you think may benefit from thoughtfully-designed yoga sequences. 

Thank you for your time, and namaste.

story: The Cottonwood Colts Water Polo team is a group of young men and women who have taken their passion for swimming to the next level. Unfortunately, club sports are not funded or supported by the schools. We have to pay for pool time, refs, suits, cages and everything involved in this sport. We have tried conventional fundraisers in the past, but instead of try and sell you something you don't need, we hope you will want to contribute, keep our program going strong and get a charitable tax write off all in one! These sports keep our kids fit, off the streets and cultivating great skills to help in life.

These sports keep our kids fit, off the streets and cultivating great skills to help in life.

story:
Save Money, Do At Home

 

 

Professional Anti-aging Results

At Home

 

The Fanci Belle is a handheld skin care device innovatively-designed with laser treatment technology to minimise fine lines and wrinkles and evening out skin tone. The Fanci Belle adopted 1470nm infrared laser diode to penetrate deep in the layers where collagen and elastin form to activating the skin’s natural defences and boost collagen and elastin production for a healthier, firmer skin tone.

 

 

How Does Fanci Belle Works?

Natural, non-invasive facial-lift using laser treatment.

 

Fanci Belle age-defying uses  1470nm infrared laser diode to stimulate collagen production under your skin. Over time the skin becomes firmer and smoother and the face has a fuller look because of the growth of natural collagen. The same laser benefits of machines used in high end spas and dermatologist offices.  

 

1470nm Infrared Laser

1470nm infrared laser is the peak wavelength for water absorption in skin and has 40 times greater absorption than the traditional vein treatment laser of 980nm, it causes significantly less pain and hence no post-operative bruising and swelling.

 

 

Who Is It For?

 

Fanci Belle, is one of the most effective laser treatments available today. You can expect results with fewer treatments and can also expect to be able to treat a wide range of conditions and needs. 

 

 

3 Modes For Various Benefits

 
 

                      √  Diminish superficial wrinkles                             √  Reduces pore size ​

 

             √  Brighten your skin color ​                                     √ Improve your skin texture ​

 

 

Safe & Comfortable Design

 

To reduce the pinch or twinge feeling on the skin during laser treatment, we add a condensing fin for the contacting surface. Glide it over your skin with smooth and comfort.

 

Condensing Fin

To reduce the pinch or twinge feeling on the skin during laser treatment, we add a condensing fin for the contacting surface. The exclusive design could cool down the skin surface temperature to 40℉-50℉ to reduce the pinch feeling on the skin that similar laser device may caused. 

 

Thermal Safety Detector

A built-in thermal safety detector is included in the device to protect users from over treating facial areas. It will automatically limits the laser treatment when it detacts you stay on a skin's surface without moving. 

​

 

 

Did You Know?

 

Featured On

 

 

Easy To Use

 

Fanci Belle gently and effectively stimulates your skin in as little as 10 minutes a day. It will auto shut-off after 10 minutes laser treatment each day. 

 

 

 

Portable For Every Occations

 

It's very easy to use at home and you don't have to go to the doctor's office. It takes anywhere 10 minutes to perform the procedure, enable you a variety of spa-quality laser treatment at your home. The Fanci Belle is a painless laser treatment that requires no recovery. In fact, the procedure is so non-invasive that some people have it done during their lunch break.

 

 

Sleek Charging Cradle


Juice up your Fanci Belle by placing it on the companion charging cradle. The cradle adds a degree of ease and style that works perfectly with the sleek body design of Fanci Belle, and it ensures your laser treatment is ready whenever you’re.

 

 

Specifications

 

Kit includes: Fanci Belle laser device, user manual, charging cradle and cord.

​

Timeline

 

 

FAQ

 

Q1 - How does the Age-Defying Laser compare to the anti-aging products that I am already using?    
A1 - The Fanci Belle uses the same non-ablative fractional laser technology previously available through dermatologists. Unlike topical products, the Fanci Belle emits microscopic columns of laser light to help stimulate new collagen below the skin’s surface. By using the Fanci Belle several minutes a day, you can expect to see visible improvement in as few as 4 weeks.

 

Q2 - When can I expect to first see results?    
A2 - You should start to see visible results like smoother skin in as few as 4 weeks, followed by fewer lines and wrinkles occurring a few weeks after the full 12-week course of treatment. As for how many treatments you need before you can see amazing results, it depends how extensive the changes are, deep wrinkles various from a little pigment or a little acne scarring.

 

Q3 - What are the possible side effects when using the Fanci Belle?    
A3 - The treatment involves no harsh chemicals or acids and there is no recovery time. 

 

Q4 - If I just saw my doctor for an anti-aging treatment, how long should I wait before using the Fanci Belle?    
A4 - Consult a health care professional first before using the Fanci Belle. In all cases, wait until the redness and swelling have dissipated. Do not treat if your skin is significantly red or swollen from a previous treatment.

 

Q5 - Is there anyone who should not use the Fanci Belle?    
A5 - The Fanci Belle is appropriate for all skin types. Do not use if you are under the age of 18, and do not allow children to play with or use this device. Consult a health care professional first if you are pregnant or undergoing professional cosmetic treatments, such as a skin peel, laser resurfacing or filler injections. Also consult a health care professional if you have a significant medical skin condition, your skin is unusually sensitive, your skin easily develops a rash or allergic reaction or if you are taking a medicine, such as a steroid. The Fanci Belle should also not be used on skin that contains permanent makeup or is tattooed, infected, burned or cut.

 

Q6 - How many times could I use Fanci Belle in one day?

Your skin need a little time for collagen and elastin production after laser treatment. So we suggest you to use Fanci Belle once a day.
story_txt:
Save Money, Do At Home

 
 
Professional Anti-aging Results 
At Home
 
The Fanci Belle is a handheld skin care device innovatively-designed with laser treatment technology to minimise fine lines and wrinkles and evening out skin tone. The Fanci Belle adopted 1470nm infrared laser diode to penetrate deep in the layers where collagen and elastin form to activating the skin’s natural defences and boost collagen and elastin production for a healthier, firmer skin tone.

 
 
How Does Fanci Belle Works?
Natural, non-invasive facial-lift using laser treatment.
 
Fanci Belle age-defying uses  1470nm infrared laser diode to stimulate collagen production under your skin. Over time the skin becomes firmer and smoother and the face has a fuller look because of the growth of natural collagen. The same laser benefits of machines used in high end spas and dermatologist offices.  

 
1470nm Infrared Laser
1470nm infrared laser is the peak wavelength for water absorption in skin and has 40 times greater absorption than the traditional vein treatment laser of 980nm, it causes significantly less pain and hence no post-operative bruising and swelling.

 
 
Who Is It For?
 
Fanci Belle, is one of the most effective laser treatments available today. You can expect results with fewer treatments and can also expect to be able to treat a wide range of conditions and needs.

story:
What We Do

 

We are Logo Mondo.

We work with Jewelry Craft Masters with average of 43 years of experience.

Logo Mondo connects together prestigious Masters with designers full of free will and audacity.

Last May, Logo Mondo held one of the precious events for our young designers.

“2017 Logo Mondo Jewelry Design Contest”

Throughout the contest, we could finally nominate 11 designers (winners) who successfully and perfectly elaborated the theme of Logo Mondo Jewelry Design Contest with their designs : Simple and Modern.

The winners of the contest all are now Logo Mondo official designers.

Before registering those winner-designed products at our Logo Mondo Website, we want to provide those at INDIEGOGO Special Price.

 

What We Sell

“Sophisticated Jewelry with Exclusive Germanium Chip”

 

Logo Mondo Co., Ltd. was established to protect Jewelry Craft-masters’ invincible techniques and promote value of jewelry throughout the world.

To blend young designers’ free and audacious insight into craft-masters’ historical crafting techniques, we nominated 11 jewelry designers through Global Jewelry Design Contest in April2017.

Plus, exclusively for this INDIEGOGO CrowdFund, we have prepared something even more special!

All the jewelry item we are providing for this Crowd Fund is equipped with Germanium Chip inside (Purity Level 99.99%).

So, taking care of your health while wearing the most beautiful jewelry connecting dream of young designers with finest techniques of jewelry craft masters will enhance your health and beauty in the most meaningful way.

NOW SELLING
(3 DAYS ONLY FOR EACH DESIGNER)

 

More Items from various young designers coming soon!
(Again, Don't forget, its 3-day exclusive sale for each designer!)

 

What We Will Do with your Funds

 

With the funds, we will first produce your own ordered-jewelry with master’s hand. Crafting and Finalizing will take a few weeks.

As the motto of our business calls for, we will try our best to enhance our jewelry platform connecting Jewelry-craft masters and young designers. Other contest and opportunities as such precious chances for designers full of hopes and dreams will be held with help of your funds.

We will share a certain portion of earned profit with our designers. They are the prime source of all the series of futuristic business.

story:
David Needs A Rustbucket Car … 

I have a friend with a rare form of cancer that affects his eyes, called Von Hipple Lanau Syndrome.  Tumors grow; some benign, some cancerous, but all must be surgically removed.  It is a hereditary disease that can skip generations, and now David has it.  His wife – we’ll just call her L – asked me if I knew any way to help David raise some money for a rustbucket car. 

Nothing fancy.  A clunker.  They have always both lived close to their jobs, so had no need for one – but now David has to make a 160-mile round trip to get his treatments.  He can still drive because the treatment is currently only in a single eye.  He took the bus for his first visit.  Impossible.  I spoke with David about it and he was adamant that he did not want to let anyone know and he didn’t want to be a burden or a charity case. 

I told him okay, but I told L that I could do whatever I wanted with regard to raising money and I will.  This is why I’ve come to you.  If only 52 people threw in 50 bucks, he’d have enough.  I thank you for taking the time to allow me to help a man who is too stubborn to let people help him.  He’s a really, really good man.  Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

We need around $2,600 U.S. so that they can find a clunker car to get David to and from his treatments.  All the funds will go directly to him and his wife.

I am an indie author, so if you donate $50 to $99.00, I will personally email you an eBook of your choice from my library of 13 books.  Eric A. Shelman - Find me at all online bookstores.  (Now, if you’re thinking that because I’m an author, I should be able to afford it myself – the word “indie” is the clue … I would if I could – that’s no lie.)

Donate $100.00 or more and I'll personally sign and mail you a copy of any one of my books or novels!  If we do not reach our goal, all money goes back to the donors - I don't want to complicate it, and as I said - he's reluctant.  I love the guy.  He's the kind of person we could use more of in this world.

The Impact You Can Have ...

Just making the difference in one man's life - making sure he knows that friends - and often strangers - care about what happens to him.

It's Hard … you can make it easier.

It's hard to keep a positive attitude when things go this wrong, particularly with a syndrome like David's … you can't fight genetics.  I want him to see the beauty of the human race and I want him to get well - and get to his distant treatments on time.
